dt: {bc}a branch of medicine concerned especially with the structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system

et: Earlier in the senses "anatomy of the nerves, description of the nervous system," probably taken from the neo-Greek coinage {it}neurología{/it} (in the genitive {it}neurologías{/it}), introduced by the English physician Thomas Willis (1621-75) in {it}Cerebri anatome, cui accessit nervorum descriptio et usus{/it} (London, 1664), p. 235.
shortdef: a branch of medicine concerned especially with the structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system
